# adjustsImageWhenAncestorFocused

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that determines whether the image view responds when an ancestor gains focus.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var adjustsImageWhenAncestorFocused: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

When the value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] and an ancestor of the image view becomes focused, the image view adjusts the frame of its image using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImageView/focusedFrameGuide] property. On supported Apple TV devices, setting this property to true renders the image with a Liquid Glass effect when it gains focus.

The default value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Managing focus-related behaviors

- **focusedFrameGuide**: The layout guide to use when the image view is focused.
- **masksFocusEffectToContents**: A Boolean value indicating whether the floating focused appearance uses the image’s alpha channel.
